glsa.title: Apache Tomcat JK Connector: Information disclosure
glsa.synopsis: An error in the Apache Tomcat JK Connector might allow for an information disclosure flaw.

background.p: The Apache Tomcat JK Connector (aka mod_jk) connects the Tomcat application server with the Apache HTTP Server.

description.p: The Red Hat Security Response Team discovered that mod_jk does not properly handle (1) requests setting the "Content-Length" header while not providing data and (2) clients sending repeated requests very quickly.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send specially crafted requests or a large number of requests at a time, possibly resulting in the disclosure of a response intended for another client.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
